a.title: Graduation and prom update
2019-2020 school calendar update
Student enrollment information
COVID-19 News Update Center

span.p: Parents, Guardians & Students, I want to thank you for all your support, flexibility and understanding, as we have been trying to navigate this situation and make decisions that support students and also keep everyone safe. Last weekend, I sent you a survey regarding graduation. Well over 100 families replied to the survey. We value […]

a.title: Permanent Link to Graduation and prom update

span.p: The Solanco school district hopes our students, parents and community are healthy during this challenging time. The last day of the school year for students in kindergarten through grade 11 will be Tuesday, June 9. The last day for seniors will be Friday, June 5. Friday, May 8 will be an instructional day. We will announce plans […]

a.title: Permanent Link to 2019-2020 school calendar update

span.p: Student enrollment information is posted on the Solanco website. Click this link - Student Enrollment – to review information about the enrollment of students in grades kindergarten through 12. Email questions to Cindy Criswell or Kathy Martin.

a.title: Permanent Link to Student enrollment information

span.p: Welcome to the Solanco School District COVID-19 update center. This space will serve as a communication tool between the school district and families in an effort to keep parents, staff, and the entire Solanco community informed on the latest news and resources with regards to the COVID -19 pandemic and its impact on our schools […]

a.title: Permanent Link to COVID-19 News Update Center

div.p: Solanco High School has announced the following information concerning Solanco Scholars and Senior Awards Night: Solanco Scholars – Thursday, May 14. a.title: Permanent Link to 2020-2021 budget development information
Permanent Link to 2020-2021 budget development information

div.p: The Solanco School Board has approved a proposed final budget for the 2020-2021 school year. The budget is available for public review, call 717.940.1513. While the $62.2-million proposed budget currently contains no property tax increase, it does have a $5.6-million deficit, primarily due to the coronavirus pandemic and the decrease it has caused in Solanco’s […]

img.title: Southern Lancaster County Chamber of Commerce honors Steve Risk for community service

div.p: Kendall Keeler, Steve Risk. Pete Rush. Steve Risk, former president of the Solanco School Board and retired from Paul Risk Associates in Quarryville, is the recipient of the third annual Community Service Award from the Southern Lancaster County Chamber of Commerce. The award recognizes a person who has provided important, lasting, volunteer public service […]

a.title: Permanent Link to Update for Solanco families – April 9
Permanent Link to Update for Solanco families – April 9

div.p: Dear Solanco Families, Today, April 9, 2020, Governor Wolf closed all Pennsylvania Schools for the remainder of the “academic year.” While this announcement was not unexpected, our planning is more certain knowing this. The Governor’s decision was based on preserving the health and safety of all residents, and our role is to provide the best […]

a.title: Permanent Link to Update from the Superintendent – April 7
Permanent Link to Update from the Superintendent – April 7

div.p: While Governor Wolf closed schools for a two-week period initially on March 13, he progressed to an “indefinite” closure thereafter. That is where we are currently—at “indefinite closure.” We anticipated a prolonged closure and began planning with that in mind. As a district, we have responded by altering our structure to meet changing needs. This […]

opportunities to maximize student academic performance in a safe and secure environment"
